question: Describe armoured brain syndrome.
ideal_answer: Armoured brain syndrome is defined by calcified chronic subdural haematoma.

snippets.text: Armoured brain is a rare condition where dense calcification occurs over the brain.
Armoured brain due to chronic subdural collections masking underlying hydrocephalus.
Calcified chronic subdural collection (armoured brain) is a known long-standing complication of shunt overdrainage.

The optimal surgical procedure for patients with calcified and organized chronic subdural haematoma (CSDH), or "armoured brain", has not been established because it is difficult to obtain good re-expansion of the brain after surgery.
